publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Rachel Dunaway Cox (1904-1996) was a professor of education and psychology at Bryn Mawr College from 1944 to 1971. She was chair of the Department of Education and Child Development and the director of the Child Study Institute. A leader in the field of child development, she published studies focusing on youth and young adults for academic publications, and occasionally also wrote articles for popular magazines. Her husband, Reavis Cox (1900-1992), served on the faculty of the University of Pennsylvania's Wharton School from 1935-1971.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains personal and a small amount of professional papers of Rachel Dunaway Cox and Reavis Cox. Materials include: correspondence with family (Dunaway and Cox families) and friends; Rachel Dunaway Cox's diaries from high school, college, and later years; Reavis Cox diaries from 1922 and 1925; travel journals and travel ephemera from trips to Europe and Asia; photographs; greeting cards; school memorabilia of Rachel Dunaway Cox, and Rosemary and David Cox; a published volume by Reavis Cox titled Distribution in a High-level Economy; a small number of professional papers of Rachel Dunaway Cox, including notes for research on adult personality; and several printed articles and drafts of speeches.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Pennsylvania, Archives and Records Center: Reavis Cox papers; Bryn Mawr College: Rachel Dunaway Cox papers.
